channel.title: Ip connections
channel.description:
i have a feeling the clienthandler is restricting connections from an ip to 1.
How can i come about changing this?
I searched the server client and i changed some things but it must nto have been the right thing, may i acquire assistance on how to change the restrictions?
I want a tutorial not direct help, learning how to do it is the best way to perfect myself on learning.
If you just tell me how to do it, please give it to me in a way i could learn :D

item.title: Ip connections
item.dc:creator: @trivenge trivenge
item.description:
@trivenge wrote:

alright ill give it a try and report back here if i get anything thanks
brb :D[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 07, 2008, 10:12:57 pm[/size][hr]i downloaded jad to oppen the class files for server and client
and for some reason something messed up, i redownloaded the content and reapplied…i get this

just a simple…null in each one…

so idk if this is wrong or what, but i downloaded a different persons files and now im back to one connection per ip. should i continue to use jad? or should i attempt sumthing else to edit it? and where could i find this so i can change this?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 08, 2008, 04:45:38 pm[/size][hr]anyone here?

item.title: Ip connections
item.dc:creator: @trivenge trivenge
item.description:
@trivenge wrote:

Well since im only trying to test it and that means its only myself, it wont allow me on, so im assuming it wont allow the localhost on. And it also states i cant have more than one connection per ip. could this be a syip thing? or maybe a server that is only a mysql or dedi type?

item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

why do you think that it’s only allowing one? Does it kick off someone when someone else logs on? or does it not allow more than yourself on…? You have to be more detailed.
